page.title: 09COLESBOURNE PARK.
page.content: Colesbourne Park has been owned for nearly 200 years,by the Elwes family. {Mr.H.J.Elwes}F.R.S.,a great traveller, collected and planted many trees in the park and created the arboretum. There are about 222 different trees some of which have never been grown in Great Britain before.The rarest tree is the{Pterocarya rhoifoli}Japanese Wingnut.The present owner Mr.H.J.Elwes is maintaining and adding to the arboretum. The house originally stood next to the church this was knocked down about 1851 by John Elwes.A large Victorian mansion was built with many new things such as cast iron girders,lifts and a type of central heating.This house was demolished and a new house built on the site in 1958.One large room remains of the Victorian house.
